title: John W. Nicholson
summary: John William "Jack" Nicholson Sr. (born February 22, 1934) is an American retired Brigadier General of the United States Army who was appointed secretary of the American Battle Monuments Commission (ABMC) by President George W. Bush in January 2005. He is the father of John W. "Mick" Nicholson Jr., also a retired general of the United States Army.
